abstract.p: Alyce C Alston is named vice president and publisher of W magazine, succeeding Susan Blank, who resigned; Delia Passi Smalter, publisher of Working Mother magazine, is named to new post of group publisher, responsible for sales and marketing at Working Mother and Working Woman magazines; Stephen P Giannetti is named to post of vice president and publisher at National Geographic magazine (S)

block.p: * Alyce C. Alston was named vice president and publisher at W magazine, New York, part of the Fairchild Publications unit of Advance Publications, succeeding Susan Blank, who left. Ms. Alston had been publisher at O: The Oprah Magazine, New York, the co-venture between the Harpo Entertainment Group and Hearst Magazines. She is succeeded there by Jill Seelig, who had been advertising director. * Delia Passi Smalter, publisher at Working Mother magazine, New York, part of the Working Woman Network, was named to the new post of group publisher, responsible for sales and marketing at Working Mother and Working Woman magazines. * Stephen P. Giannetti was named to the post of vice president and publisher at National Geographic magazine, New York, owned by the National Geographic Society. He was vice president at Rodale Inc., New York, and publisher at Prevention magazine, which is published by Rodale.

Ms. Alston had been publisher at O: The Oprah Magazine, New York, the co-venture between the Harpo Entertainment Group and Hearst Magazines. She is succeeded there by Jill Seelig, who had been advertising director. * Delia Passi Smalter, publisher at Working Mother magazine, New York, part of the Working Woman Network, was named to the new post of group publisher, responsible for sales and marketing at Working Mother and Working Woman magazines. * Stephen P. Giannetti was named to the post of vice president and publisher at National Geographic magazine, New York, owned by the National Geographic Society. He was vice president at Rodale Inc., New York, and publisher at Prevention magazine, which is published by Rodale.
